intro: Praravinia affinis, commonly known as the common praravinia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Praravinia affinis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along streams.
